subject: Come to Worldcon
event:
Having fun in Melbourne.

Aussiecon IV starts on Thursday, officially, but people are already arriving.  WE're here, obviously.  So is GOH Kim STanley Robinson,  Greg Benford, others.  More arriving every day.

If you're a fan of SF or fantasy -- not just my stuff, any SF or fantasy --  and live in Australia, you owe it to yourself to get your ass to worldcon.  This is THE event on the fannish calendar, the granddaddy of all other cons.  The last time it was in Australia was 1999.  It may be another ten years before it returns again.  It may never return again.  So let's not hear mutters about other commitments and similar feeble excuses.  JUst do it.

Yes, I will be doing a signing in Sydney.  But a signing is a poor substitute for a con.  At a sgning you'll stand in line for hours to get maybe thirty seconds with me... or whatever writer you're queuing up for.  AT a con you can spend a whole weekend with your favroite riters and fellow fns.  THere are parties, drinking, panels, drinking, readings, drinking, quests, drinking, flirtations, the dealers room, the art show, drinking... and yes, signings too.

comments.article:
Mr. Martin it would appear you are enjoying yourself quite well in Australia. I am quite envious. It would appear so because the spelling as your post concluded got worse and worse. Party on Mr. Martin. It would be an amazing experience to have a drink with one of my favourite authors. :D

One day good sir, one day.
I want to be there so bad!
Very jealous! I wish everybody who can make it the best of times!

sounds so fun!  I wish I wasn't a poor college student so I could fly out there and join!  Can't wait til the next book! You are a wonderful writer.  My father is actually writing a fantasy series right now.. so if you ever read these, you should check out his book when it comes out.  Sorry for the rambling... I have been drinking.  Though I wish I had been drinking at the con.  Ok i'm done.
You might want to note that a certain British fan is organizing a real ale pub crawl on Wednesday evening: details here.

Borrowing Parris's notebook, George? I hate those damned flush keys on keyboards these days, I swear I lose 20 WPM.

For those considering going to the con, the Brotherhood without Banners will be representing. Two room parties are scheduled, and the traditional quest to win your knighthood is on the books (The Knights of the Shrimp on the Barbie? The Knights of the Vegemite Perilous? Only George knows for sure what perilous item will have to be obtained...)

You can learn more about this and everything else having to do with the BwB presence at AussieCon at Westeros.org.

Oh, and for those in Sydney, the signing George mentions will take place on September 13 at Galaxy Books, 12:30PM (details via Voyager Books Australia).

If it ever comes near Berlin I'll sure as hell will be there. But sadly Germany is not the best terrain for SciFi or Fantasy. Just saw that Worldcon was in Heidelberg in 1970, odd choice as a German city...

And btw: Pizza at Lombardi's was great, thx for the tip George!

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article: Will there be drinking?
Beat me to it :P

Ah, it's my dream to get to worldcon someday!  I am glad the destination is turning out to be a lot more fun than the journey in this instance.  Kim Stanley Robinson's books are on the same reading rotation in our home as yours - ;)  fun stuff!  Enjoy, everyone who will be there.
You've convinced me! I'm on a plane tomorrow!

"favroite riters and fellow fns. THere are parties"

Laughed out loud. Thanks.
Now you know why I don't write while on the road.  I adapt very badly to strange computers, and my huge old DOS destktop is too big to lug around.

It felt closer to 15 when I had you sign Feast for me... even with me asking you a question which you easily answered, and me wish I had remembered that particular detail myself, and asked you something better!
comments.subject: 30 seconds?

comments.article: Indeed. :) I met you at Noreascon 4, and that is a very apt description.
Too much drinking, not enough quests and flirting.
Whooo! Can't wait. We don't get there until late Wednesday night - but I'm looking forward to seeing everyone in the days that follow!

Ah, I wish! I live in Montreal and saw you last year at WorldCon here, but not at a panel or anything, they were too full; just on an escalator while you were going up and I was going down or vice versa; hard to shout "love your work GRRM!" under those circumstances {g}!

Hope you continue to have a lovely time (as you clearly already are) and hope my big bro Richard does the same (although he's very worried about a very ill cat at home).

Unjustified capital letters? Misspellings abound? Hmmm... a secret message? With the caps and missing letters I get: WE    JU  I  AT   O   W    A    TH. I could be missing parts, or am simply paranoid. Any thoughts??? Maybe GRRM is at the honeyed rum. . .
comments.subject: Code in message??

comments.article:
See you soon Mr George, you too Mr John.

I can see the con hall from my office, not that it matters since I'll be there when it's actually on. Maybe I'll see some of you fine Authors wandering about town.
I'm jealous, after reading that post I'd say the party was very much in full swing.

Geees I wish I had known more about cons ..... when I checked out the website a while back it just had a price for attending the whole thing, which sadly is way out of my price range. I only recently saw you could go for just one day! Sadly too late for me to organise a trip to Melbourne :(

Hello! I got  Live Journal account just so I could reply to this. I am in Melbourne but none of my friends want to come with me to AussieCon. Any non-axe murderers want to be my friend for a day? I promise I'm not weird, just that my friends read boring stuff like Dickens and Voltaire rather than fantasy. GRRM, has anybody ever taken you to an Aussie Rules match? I'd be honoured ... ?
comments.subject: I need friends!

comments.article: Fans are generally friendly people, so I wouldn't worry about showing up alone. You'll make friends. And give Dickens some genre cred -- he wrote one of the most famous ghost stories ever.
comments.subject: Re: I need friends!

comments.article:
I've never been to a con but I've wanted to go to one for quite a while. I just moved to the UK - I was wondering if you could recommend any. I'm not sure what to look for when I google it, but I like reading/writing and sci fi/fantasy and overall it seems like a good time full of interesting people. Apologies again if this is somewhat irrelevant, I just thought you may have some advice!

Australia's worldcon seems amazing, but it's too far for me to go currently.
comments.subject: UK Cons?

comments.article:
George is going to be in Dublin at Octocon in mid-October -- very much recommended. I understand flights over to Ireland are plentiful and cheap, too. London seems the likely winner of the 2014 Worldcon bid at this stage, but ... yeah, a way's off. The big SF literary con each year would be, I think, Eastercon. It'll be in Birmingham this year. It sort of seems that it's very focused on science fiction, though -- not sure how much fantasy is represented.

FantasyCon seems like a nice, small con thrown together by the British Fantasy Society. It's just a couple weeks away.

An excellent resource for keeping an eye on the conventions is Locus Online and their convention list.
comments.subject: Re: UK Cons?

comments.article: I'm eagerly counting down the days!
Mr. Martin, as I am a huge fan of your work, I would love to come to Australia and party down.  Would you mind paying my way?(yes, this is a joke.)
comments.subject: I would love too.

comments.article: drink one for me
Now that's a type of entry you don't see every day.  I wonder what Mr. Martin's favorite drink is?
comments.subject: Wow.
